title: Top New York Fed Lawyer to Leave Bank in June
sub_head: Until a successor is found, deputy counsels will lead the bank’s legal group
body:
The Federal Reserve Bank of New York’s top lawyer is leaving the bank.
Michael Held, 52, has resigned as the New York Fed’s general counsel and head of its legal group, the bank said in a press release Thursday. Mr. Held will stay on in an advisory role until he leaves the bank in June.
